query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Final Czech Roadmap and Action Plan for Residential Buildings
result.description: The Roadmap and the relevant Action Plan after language review, formatting and printed.The Roadmaps for implementing SF4SB (Roadmaps) will have the following structure:•Executive Summary;•High-level assumptions from the status quo analysis;•Overall Strategy for implementing the SF4SB in Slovakia;•Key Objectives for 2030 and 2050 and, if deemed necessary by the stakeholders, Supporting Objectives with the agreed concertation among stakeholders;•Measures for delivering the agreed objectives;•The terms for regular review of the Roadmaps;•Action Plans for implementing measures agreed in the Roadmaps.The Action Plans will include:•Detailing the actions for implementing the measures agreed in the Roadmaps;•Identification of the stakeholders involved in each action;•The timeframe for carrying out each action;•Assessment of the expected cost/budgets needed;•Identification of the resource(s) of funding.Language: Czech, executive summary in English

result.title: Framework for legal support to citizens
result.description: The project will follow a mentoring scheme in this WP, as it will be used in WP3. This will be conducted via: (I) face-to-face meetings and direct communication between citizens and local authorities (II) the communication tools that will include all results from the project’s action concerning the legislative and administrative framework, as well as incentives possibilities, and (III) the guidance provided from each pilot OSS step-by-step during the process of the project. Each partner will register and share the difficulties they encounter with other partners, as among the consortium there might be some partners that have already overcome these hindrances. So, the overall consortium will take advantage of experiences from other countries in the overcoming of these blockages.

result.title: Implementation and Replication Policy Guidelines to Slovak Roadmap for Non-residential Buildings
result.description: The Implementation and Replication Policy Guidelines will include:•Executive Summary;•Origination of the policy paper (including which Roadmaps’ objectives are supported);•Justification for the policy and actions to be taken;•Formulations of the relevant measures for the Roadmaps;•Details of the actions to be taken;•Note on the process of the stakeholders’ consultation; •Timeframe for implementation and review of the paper, the agreed measures and actions.The role of replication guidelines is facilitating implementation of successful European and national initiatives from other Member States by exploiting know-how and resources generated by relevant H2020 projects.Language: Slovak, executive summary in English

result.title: Analysis of Distributed Ledger Technology (e.g. blockchain) Potential to Facilitate Community Collective Action
result.description: Investigating distributed ledger technology (e.g. blockchain) potential in the UP-STAIRS platform will be of significant importance, thus ensuring that the platform remains relevant with current practices. ESEB will lead this collaborative research with the other partners, with the intention of producing a detailed report, outlining the future inclusion of blockchain in the platform and how it can facilitate the next level of collective action effort.

result.title: Organise one-day workshops with relevant stakeholders and producing an outcome report.2
result.description: The objective of this task is to organize 3 workshops to engage decision makers, and share the identified regulatory barriers and potential solutions for collective actions and discussing best ways to communicate with citizens. The workshops would focus on brainstorming the solutions, presenting project success cases and discussing further actions through the world café approach if suitable. Each workshop will be placed strategically to maximize impact to policy and decision-makers. A workshop outcome report will be delivered after each workshop. Updates to the UP-STAIRS Energy Service Framework will be applied as appropriate.

result.title: Implementation and Replication Policy Guidelines to Czech Roadmap for City Infrastructure
result.description: The Implementation and Replication Policy Guidelines will include:•Executive Summary;•Origination of the policy paper (including which Roadmaps’ objectives are supported);•Justification for the policy and actions to be taken;•Formulations of the relevant measures for the Roadmaps;•Details of the actions to be taken;•Note on the process of the stakeholders’ consultation; •Timeframe for implementation and review of the paper, the agreed measures and actions.The role of replication guidelines is facilitating implementation of successful European and national initiatives from other Member States by exploiting know-how and resources generated by relevant H2020 projects.Language: Czech, executive summary in English

result.title: Self-training modules for citizens and potential UP-STAIRS IC
result.description: With the lessons learned during the pilots, training modules for self-training will be developed. They will target two profiles: citizens willing to promote collective actions, and energy consultants/experts to act as UP-STAIRS IC. ECO will develop a self-guide document with practical information on OSS business models, how to set up a collective action, and which legal steps have to be considered. SEC will develop a self-training guide on financial models and which financial schemes can be used along with financial performance information. ASEN will develop a training guide on the OSS governance structure and coordinate with ECO and SEC based on the pilot results. KAPE will provide a training document on understanding policies in a practical way. The modules will consist of videos and materials that will be uploaded to the website. All material will be in English.

result.title: Final working text of the Czech Roadmap for Industrial Buildings
result.description: The Roadmaps for implementing SF4SB (Roadmaps) will have the following structure:•Executive Summary;•High-level assumptions from the status quo analysis;•Overall Strategy for implementing the SF4SB in Slovakia;•Key Objectives for 2030 and 2050 and, if deemed necessary by the stakeholders, Supporting Objectives with the agreed concertation among stakeholders;•Measures for delivering the agreed objectives;•The terms for regular review of the Roadmaps.Language: Czech, executive summary in English

result.title: Final Slovak Roadmap and Action Plan for Residential Buildings
result.description: The Roadmap and the relevant Action Plan after language review, formatting and printed.The Roadmaps for implementing SF4SB (Roadmaps) will have the following structure:•Executive Summary;•High-level assumptions from the status quo analysis;•Overall Strategy for implementing the SF4SB in Slovakia;•Key Objectives for 2030 and 2050 and, if deemed necessary by the stakeholders, Supporting Objectives with the agreed concertation among stakeholders;•Measures for delivering the agreed objectives;•The terms for regular review of the Roadmaps;•Action Plans for implementing measures agreed in the Roadmaps.The Action Plans will include:•Detailing the actions for implementing the measures agreed in the Roadmaps;•Identification of the stakeholders involved in each action;•The timeframe for carrying out each action;•Assessment of the expected cost/budgets needed;•Identification of the resource(s) of funding.Language: Slovak, executive summary in English

result.title: A comprehensive policy paper on facilitating collective actions
result.description: Based on the experience of the implemented pilots and the legal findings, UP-STAIRS will elaborate a policy paper to highlight actions to create better conditions for boosting collective actions and engaging consumers in energy transition. The policy paper will be drafted from the pilots’ lessons learned but will have a EU-wide scope and also provide regional/national policy recommendations as appropriate.

result.title: Final project conference
result.description: UP-STAIRS partners will host and participate in a final conference to be held towards the end of the programme (M39) where the project team will present its outcomes and the future steps towards the use of UP-STAIRS across the European Union. The final conference will address experts, energy managers, researchers, local authorities, large enterprises CEOs, and policy makers wishing to be informed of the programme results to exploit them in their local, national and international environments.

result.title: Organise one-day workshops with relevant stakeholders and producing an outcome report.3
result.description: The objective of this task is to organize 3 workshops to engage decision makers, and share the identified regulatory barriers and potential solutions for collective actions and discussing best ways to communicate with citizens. The workshops would focus on brainstorming the solutions, presenting project success cases and discussing further actions through the world café approach if suitable. Each workshop will be placed strategically to maximize impact to policy and decision-makers. A workshop outcome report will be delivered after each workshop. Updates to the UP-STAIRS Energy Service Framework will be applied as appropriate.

result.title: Open days and other dissemination events in the targeted countries
result.description: 2 Open door events (one in Slovakia and one in the Czech Republic) will be organised by the partners to support dissemination and exploitation of the project's outcomes. These events will be organised as a part of larger gatherings attracting large number of stakeholders such as conferences, exhibitions and fairs.

result.title: Final working text of the Slovak Roadmap for City Infrastructures
result.description: The Roadmaps for implementing SF4SB (Roadmaps) will have the following structure:•Executive Summary;•High-level assumptions from the status quo analysis;•Overall Strategy for implementing the SF4SB in Slovakia;•Key Objectives for 2030 and 2050 and, if deemed necessary by the stakeholders, Supporting Objectives with the agreed concertation among stakeholders;•Measures for delivering the agreed objectives;•The terms for regular review of the Roadmaps.Language: Slovak, executive summary in English

result.title: Digital Platform Test Plan and Test Results
result.description: This task will be led by GCN and will include a series of tests that will be carried out on the web-based and mobile applications of the UP-STAIRS platform. In addition, it will describe a series of use cases aimed at ensuring that the project delivers on its objectives and meets the requirements defined in the Software Project Management Plan (SPMP). Testing will be carried out throughout the project (Unit / Regression) and as this is an agile process, all partners will contribute to carrying out the tests described in the testing plan. This task will deliver a thorough Software Testing Report including the results of the tests described in the Software Testing Plan.

result.title: Implementation and Replication Policy Guidelines to Czech Roadmap for Industrial Buildings
result.description: The Implementation and Replication Policy Guidelines will include:•Executive Summary;•Origination of the policy paper (including which Roadmaps’ objectives are supported);•Justification for the policy and actions to be taken;•Formulations of the relevant measures for the Roadmaps;•Details of the actions to be taken;•Note on the process of the stakeholders’ consultation; •Timeframe for implementation and review of the paper, the agreed measures and actions.The role of replication guidelines is facilitating implementation of successful European and national initiatives from other Member States by exploiting know-how and resources generated by relevant H2020 projects.Language: Czech, executive summary in English

result.title: Monitoring programme for OSS practical operation
result.description: In order to collect information and draw conclusions about practical implementation of OSS models for collective action, a special monitoring programme will be developed starting from the first month of OSS operation (M18). This programme will consist of parameters to be monitored (both qualitative and quantitative), target stakeholders to be addressed (mainly IC but also local authorities, representatives of local energy communities, etc.), specific tools to be used (questionnaires for data collection, interviews, methodologies for data processing), and time-schedule for monitoring
